result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

9:16 AM Defendant Chase R Haldeman in court in custody at the Rock County Jail by video with attorney Kelly James Mattingly by video. Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Victim A.C. appeared in court by video. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily. Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court, jury trial to be set, bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on March 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Preliminary hearing requested by zoom. Time limits waived. Signature bond conditions modified to no violent or disorderly contact with A.E.C. No discussion of case with A.E.C. Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $1650 set with conditions of court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.
